        All troublemakers brag about themselves.
94.5:
They crush your people, O Yahweh.
    They make those who belong to you suffer.
94.6: They kill widows and foreigners, and they murder orphans.
94.7:
They say, “Yah doesn’t see it.
                The Elohim of Jacob doesn’t even pay attention to it.”
94.8:
Pay attention, you stupid people!
    When will you become wise, you fools?
94.9:
Elohim created ears.
    Do you think he can’t hear?
    He formed eyes.
        Do you think he can’t see?
94.10:
He disciplines nations.
    Do you think he can’t punish?
    He teaches people.
        Do you think he doesn’t know anything?
94.11: Yahweh knows that people’s thoughts are pointless.
94.12:
O Yah, blessed is the person
    whom you discipline and instruct from your teachings.
94.13:
You give him peace and quiet from times of trouble
    while a pit is dug to trap wicked people.
94.14:
Yahweh will never desert his people
    or abandon those who belong to him.
94.15:
The decisions of judges will again become fair,
    and everyone whose motives are decent will pursue justice.
94.16:
Who will stand up for me against evildoers?
    Who will stand by my side against troublemakers?
94.17:
If Yahweh had not come to help me,
    my soul would have quickly fallen silent in death.
94.18:
When I said, “My feet are slipping,”
    your mercy, O Yahweh, continued to hold me up.
94.19:
When I worried about many things,
    your assuring words soothed my soul.
94.20:
Are wicked rulers who use the law to do unlawful things
    able to be your partners?
94.21:
They join forces to take the lives of righteous people.
    They condemn innocent people to death.
94.22:
Yahweh has become my stronghold.
    My Elohim has become my rock of refuge.
94.23:
He has turned their own wickedness against them.
    He will destroy them because of their sins.
        Yahweh our Elohim will destroy them.

95.1:
Come, let’s sing joyfully to Yahweh.
    Let’s shout happily to the rock of our salvation.
95.2:
Let’s come into his presence with a song of thanksgiving.
    Let’s shout happily to him with psalms.
95.3: Yahweh is a great El and a great Melek above all gods.
95.4:
In his hand are the deep places of the earth,
    and the mountain peaks are his.
95.5:
The sea is his.
    He made it, and his hands formed the dry land.
95.6:
Come, let’s worship and bow down.
    Let’s kneel in front of Yahweh, our maker,
95.7:
because he is our Elohim
            and we are the people in his care,
                the flock that he leads.
If only you would listen to him today!
95.8:
“Do not be stubborn like my people were at Meribah,
    like the time at Massah in the desert.
95.9:
Your ancestors challenged me and tested me there,
            although they had seen what I had done.
95.10:
For 40 years I was disgusted with those people.
    So I said, ‘They are a people whose hearts continue to stray.
        They have not learned my ways.’
95.11:
That is why I angrily took this solemn oath:
    ‘They will never enter my place of rest!’”

96.1:
Sing to Yahweh a new song!
    Sing to Yahweh, all the earth!
96.2:
Sing to Yahweh! Praise his name!
    Day after day announce that Yahweh saves his people.
96.3:
Tell people about his glory.
        Tell all the nations about his miracles.
96.4:
Yahweh is great!
    He should be highly praised.
    He should be feared more than all other gods
96.5:
because all the gods of the nations are idols.
    Yahweh made the heavens.
96.6:
Splendor and majesty are in his presence.
    Strength and beauty are in his holy place.
96.7:
Give to Yahweh, you families of the nations.
    Give to Yahweh glory and power.
96.8:
Give to Yahweh the glory he deserves.
    Bring an offering, and come into his courtyards.
96.9:
Worship Yahweh in his holy splendor.
    Tremble in his presence, all the earth!
96.10:
Say to the nations, “Yahweh rules as king!”
    The earth stands firm; it cannot be moved.
    He will judge people fairly.
96.11:
Let the heavens rejoice and the earth be glad.
    Let the sea and everything in it roar like thunder.
96.12:
Let the fields and everything in them rejoice.
    Then all the trees in the forest will sing joyfully
96.13:
in Yahweh’s presence because he is coming.
    He is coming to judge the earth.
        He will judge the world with righteousness
    and its people with his truth.

97.1:
Yahweh rules as king.
    Let the earth rejoice.
    Let all the islands be joyful.
97.2:
Clouds and darkness surround him.
    Righteousness and justice are the foundations of his throne.
97.3:
Fire spreads ahead of him.
    It burns his enemies who surround him.
97.4:
His flashes of lightning light up the world.
    The earth sees them and trembles.
97.5:
The mountains melt like wax in the presence of Yahweh,
    in the presence of the Adonay of the whole earth.
97.6:
The heavens tell about his righteousness,
    and all the people of the world see his glory.
97.7:
Everyone who worships idols
    and brags about false gods will be put to shame.
    All the gods will bow to him.
97.8:
Zion hears about this and rejoices.
    The people of Judah are delighted with your judgments, O Yahweh.
97.9:
You, O Yahweh Elyon, are above the whole earth.
    You are highest. You are above all the gods.
97.10:
Let those who love Yahweh hate evil.
    The one who guards the lives of his godly ones
    will rescue them from the power of wicked people.
97.11:
Light dawns for righteous people
    and joy for those whose motives are decent.
97.12:
Find joy in Yahweh, you righteous people.
    Give thanks to him as you remember how holy he is.

98.1:
Sing a new song to Yahweh
    because he has done miraculous things.
        His right hand and his holy arm have gained victory for him.
98.2:
Yahweh has made his salvation known.
    He has uncovered his righteousness for the nations to see.
98.3:
He has not forgotten to be merciful and faithful
    to Israel’s descendants.
        All the ends of the earth have seen how our Elohim saves them.
98.4:
Shout happily to Yahweh, all the earth.
    Break out into joyful singing, and make music.
98.5:
Make music to Yahweh with a lyre,
    with a lyre and the melody of a psalm,
98.6:
with trumpets and the playing of a ram’s horn.
    Shout happily in the presence of the Melek, Yahweh.
98.7:
Let the sea, everything in it,
    the world, and those who live in it roar like thunder.
98.8:
Let the rivers clap their hands
    and the mountains sing joyfully
98.9:
in Yahweh’s presence
            because he is coming to judge the earth.
                He will judge the world with justice
                    and its people with fairness.

99.1:
Yahweh rules as king.
    Let the people tremble.
    He is enthroned over the angels.
    Let the earth quake.
99.2:
Yahweh is mighty in Zion.
    He is high above all people.
99.3:
Let them give thanks to your great and fearful name.
    He is holy!
99.4:
The king’s strength is that he loves justice.
    You have established fairness.
    You have done what is fair and right for Jacob.
99.5:
Highly honor Yahweh our Elohim.
    Bow down at his footstool.
    He is holy!
99.6:
Moses and Aaron were among his priests.
    Samuel was among those who prayed to him.
    They called to Yahweh, and he answered them.
99.7:
He spoke to them from a column of smoke.
    They obeyed his written instructions and the laws that he gave them.
99.8:
O Yahweh, our Elohim, you answered them.
    You showed them that you are a forgiving El
        and that you are an El who punishes their sinful deeds.
99.9:
Highly honor Yahweh our Elohim.
    Bow at his holy mountain.
    Yahweh our Elohim is holy!

100.1: Shout happily to Yahweh, all the earth.
100.2:
Serve Yahweh cheerfully.
    Come into his presence with a joyful song.
100.3:
Realize that Yahweh alone is Elohim.
    He made us, and we are his.
    We are his people and the sheep in his care.
100.4:
Enter his gates with a song of thanksgiving.
    Come into his courtyards with a song of praise.
    Give thanks to him; praise his name.
100.5:
Yahweh is good.
    His mercy endures forever.
    His faithfulness endures throughout every generation.

101.1:
I will sing about mercy and justice.
    O Yahweh, I will make music to praise you.
101.2:
I want to understand the path to integrity.
    When will you come to me?
I will live in my own home with integrity.
101.3:
I will not put anything wicked in front of my eyes.
    I hate what unfaithful people do.
    I want no part of it.
101.4:
I will keep far away from devious minds.
    I will have nothing to do with evil.
101.5:
I will destroy anyone who secretly slanders his neighbor.
    I will not tolerate anyone with a conceited look or arrogant heart.
101.6:
My eyes will be watching the faithful people in the land
    so that they may live with me.
        The person who lives with integrity will serve me.
101.7:
The one who does deceitful things will not stay in my home.
    The one who tells lies will not remain in my presence.
101.8:
Every morning I will destroy all the wicked people in the land
    to rid Yahweh’s city of all troublemakers.

102.1:
O Yahweh, hear my prayer,
    and let my cry for help come to you.
102.2:
Do not hide your face from me when I am in trouble.
    Turn your ear toward me.
        Answer me quickly when I call.
102.3:
My days disappear like smoke.
    My bones burn like hot coals.
102.4:
My heart is beaten down and withered like grass
    because I have forgotten about eating.
102.5:
I am nothing but skin and bones
    because of my loud groans.
102.6:
I am like a desert owl,
    like an owl living in the ruins.
102.7:
I lie awake.
    I am like a lonely bird on a rooftop.
102.8:
All day long my enemies insult me.
    Those who ridicule me use my name as a curse.
102.9:
I eat ashes like bread
    and my tears are mixed with my drink
102.10:
because of your hostility and anger,
    because you have picked me up and thrown me away.
102.11:
My days are like a shadow that is getting longer,
    and I wither away like grass.
102.12:
But you, O Yahweh, remain forever.
    You are remembered throughout every generation.
102.13:
You will rise and have compassion on Zion,
    because it is time to grant a favor to it.
        Indeed, the appointed time has come.
102.14:
Your servants value Zion’s stones,
    and they pity its rubble.
102.15:
The nations will fear Yahweh’s name.
    All the kings of the earth will fear your glory.
102.16:
When Yahweh builds Zion,
    he will appear in his glory.
102.17:
He will turn his attention to the prayers
    of those who have been abandoned.
    He will not despise their prayers.
102.18:
This will be written down for a future generation
    so that a people yet to be created may praise Yah:
102.19:
“Yahweh looked down from his holy place high above.
    From heaven he looked at the earth.
102.20:
He heard the groans of the prisoners
    and set free those who were condemned to death.
102.21:
Yahweh’s name is announced in Zion
    and his praise in Jerusalem
102.22:
when nations and kingdoms gather
    to worship Yahweh.”
102.23:
He has weakened my strength along the way.
    He has reduced the number of my days.
102.24:
I said, “My El, don’t take me now in the middle of my life.
    Your years continue on throughout every generation.
102.25:
Long ago you laid the foundation of the earth.
    Even the heavens are the works of your hands.
102.26:
They will come to an end, but you will still go on.
    They will all wear out like clothing.
        You will change them like clothes,
            and they will be thrown away.
102.27: But you remain the same, and your life will never end.
102.28:
The children of your servants will go on living here.
    Their descendants will be secure in your presence.”

103.1:
Praise Yahweh, my soul!
    Praise his holy name, all that is within me.
103.2:
Praise Yahweh, my soul,
    and never forget all the good he has done:
103.3:
He is the one who forgives all your sins,
            the one who heals all your diseases,
103.4:
the one who rescues your life from the pit,
            the one who crowns you with mercy and compassion,
103.5:
the one who fills your life with blessings
                so that you become young again like an eagle.
103.6:
Yahweh does what is right and fair
    for all who are oppressed.
103.7:
He let Moses know his ways.
        He let the Israelites know the things he had done.
103.8:
Yahweh is compassionate, merciful, patient,
    and always ready to forgive.
103.9:
He will not always accuse us of wrong
    or be angry with us forever.
103.10:
He has not treated us as we deserve for our sins
    or paid us back for our wrongs.
103.11:
As high as the heavens are above the earth—
    that is how vast his mercy is toward those who fear him.
103.12:
As far as the east is from the west—
    that is how far he has removed our rebellious acts from himself.
103.13:
As a father has compassion for his children,
    so Yahweh has compassion for those who fear him.
103.14:
He certainly knows what we are made of.
    He bears in mind that we are dust.
103.15:
Human life is as short-lived as grass.
    It blossoms like a flower in the field.
103.16:
When the wind blows over the flower, it disappears,
    and there is no longer any sign of it.
103.17:
But from everlasting to everlasting,
    Yahweh’s mercy is on those who fear him.
        His righteousness belongs
            to their children and grandchildren,
103.18:
to those who are faithful to his promise,
    to those who remember to follow his guiding principles.
103.19:
Yahweh has set his throne in heaven.
    His kingdom rules everything.
103.20:
Praise Yahweh, all his angels,
    you mighty beings who carry out his orders
        and are ready to obey his spoken orders.
103.21:
Praise Yahweh, all his armies,
    his servants who carry out his will.
103.22:
Praise Yahweh, all his creatures
    in all the places of his empire.
    Praise Yahweh, my soul!

104.1:
Praise Yahweh my soul!
    O Yahweh my Elohim, you are very great.
    You are clothed with splendor and majesty.
104.2:
You cover yourself with light as though it were a robe.
    You stretch out the heavens as though they were curtains.
104.3:
You lay the beams of your home in the water.
    You use the clouds for your chariot.
    You move on the wings of the wind.
104.4:
You make your angels winds
    and your servants flames of fire.
104.5:
You set the earth on its foundations
    so that it can never be shaken.
104.6:
You covered the earth with an ocean as though it were a robe.
    Water stood above the mountains
104.7:
and fled because of your threat.
    Water ran away at the sound of your thunder.
104.8:
The mountains rose and the valleys sank
            to the place you appointed for them.
104.9:
Water cannot cross the boundary you set
    and cannot come back to cover the earth.
104.10:
You make water gush from springs into valleys.
    It flows between the mountains.
104.11:
Every wild animal drinks from them.
    Wild donkeys quench their thirst.
104.12:
The birds live by the streams.
    They sing among the branches.
104.13:
You water the mountains from your home above.
    You fill the earth with the fruits of your labors.
104.14:
You make grass grow for cattle
    and make vegetables for humans to use
        in order to get food from the ground.
104.15:
You make wine to cheer human hearts,
    olive oil to make faces shine,
        and bread to strengthen human hearts.
104.16:
Yahweh’s trees, the cedars in Lebanon which he planted,
    drink their fill.
104.17:
Birds build their nests in them.
    Storks make their homes in fir trees.
104.18:
The high mountains are for wild goats.
    The rocks are a refuge for badgers.
104.19:
He created the moon, which marks the seasons,
    and the sun, which knows when to set.
104.20:
He brings darkness, and it is nighttime,
    when all the wild animals in the forest come out.
104.21:
The young lions roar for their prey
    and seek their food from God.
104.22:
When the sun rises,
    they gather and lie down in their dens.
104.23:
Then people go to do their work,
    to do their tasks until evening.
104.24:
What a large number of things you have made, O Yahweh!
    You made them all by wisdom.
        The earth is filled with your creatures.
104.25:
The sea is so big and wide with countless creatures,
    living things both large and small.
104.26:
Ships sail on it,
    and Leviathan, which you made, plays in it.
104.27: All of them look to you to give them their food at the right time.
104.28:
You give it to them, and they gather it up.
    You open your hand, and they are filled with blessings.
104.29:
You hide your face, and they are terrified.
    You take away their breath, and they die and return to dust.
104.30:
You send out your Ruach, and they are created.
    You renew the face of the earth.
104.31:
May the glory of Yahweh endure forever.
    May Yahweh find joy in what he has made.
104.32:
He looks at the earth, and it trembles.
    He touches the mountains, and they smoke.
104.33:
I will sing to Yahweh throughout my life.
    I will make music to praise my Elohim as long as I live.
104.34:
May my thoughts be pleasing to him.
    I will find joy in Yahweh.
104.35:
May sinners vanish from the world.
    May there no longer be any wicked people.
    Praise Yahweh, my soul!
Hallelujah!

105.1:
Give thanks to Yahweh.
    Call on him.
    Make known among the nations what he has done.
105.2:
Sing to him.
    Make music to praise him.
    Meditate on all the miracles he has performed.
105.3:
Brag about his holy name.
    Let the hearts of those who seek Yahweh rejoice.
105.4:
Search for Yahweh and his strength.
    Always seek his presence.
105.5:
Remember the miracles he performed,
    the amazing things he did, and the judgments he pronounced,
105.6:
you descendants of his servant Abraham,
        you descendants of Jacob, his chosen ones.
105.7:
He is Yahweh our Elohim.
    His judgments are pronounced throughout the earth.
105.8:
He always remembers his promise,
    the word that he commanded for a thousand generations,
105.9:
the promise that he made to Abraham,
            and his sworn oath to Isaac.
105.10:
He confirmed it as a law for Jacob,
    as an everlasting promise to Israel,
105.11:
by saying, “I will give you the land of Canaan.
    It is your share of the inheritance.”
105.12:
While the people of Israel were few in number,
    a small group of foreigners living in that land,
105.13:
they wandered from nation to nation,
    from one kingdom to another.
105.14:
He didn’t permit anyone to oppress them.
    He warned kings about them:
105.15:
“Do not touch my anointed ones
    or harm my prophets.”
105.16:
He brought famine to the land.
    He took away their food supply.
105.17:
He sent a man ahead of them.
    He sent Joseph, who was sold as a slave.
105.18:
They hurt his feet with shackles,
    and cut into his neck with an iron collar.
105.19:
Yahweh’s promise tested him through fiery trials
    until his prediction came true.
105.20:
The king sent someone to release him.
    The ruler of nations set him free.
105.21:
He made Joseph the master of his palace
    and the ruler of all his possessions.
105.22:
Joseph trained the king’s officers the way he wanted
    and taught his respected leaders wisdom.
105.23:
Then Israel came to Egypt.
    Jacob lived as a foreigner in the land of Ham.
105.24:
Yahweh made his people grow rapidly in number
    and stronger than their enemies.
105.25:
He changed their minds so that they hated his people,
    and they dealt treacherously with his servants.
105.26: He sent his servant Moses, and he sent Aaron, whom he had chosen.
105.27:
They displayed his miraculous signs among them
    and did amazing things in the land of Ham.
105.28:
He sent darkness and made their land dark.
    They did not rebel against his orders.
105.29:
He turned their water into blood
    and caused their fish to die.
105.30:
He made their land swarm with frogs,
    even in the kings’ bedrooms.
105.31:
He spoke, and swarms of flies and gnats
    infested their whole territory.
105.32:
He gave them hail and lightning
    instead of rain throughout their land.
105.33:
He struck their grapevines and fig trees
    and smashed the trees in their territory.
105.34: He spoke, and countless locusts and grasshoppers came.
105.35:
They devoured all the plants in the land.
    They devoured the crops in the fields.
105.36:
He killed all the firstborn sons,
    the first ones born in the land when their fathers were young.
105.37:
He brought Israel out with silver and gold,
    and no one among his tribes stumbled.
105.38:
The Egyptians were terrified of Israel,
    so they were glad when Israel left.
105.39:
He spread out a cloud as a protective covering
    and a fire to light up the night.
105.40:
The Israelites asked, and he brought them quail
    and filled them with bread from heaven.
105.41:
He opened a rock, and water gushed
    and flowed like a river through the dry places.
105.42: He remembered his holy promise to his servant Abraham.
105.43:
He brought his people out with joy,
    his chosen ones with a song of joy.
105.44:
He gave them the lands of other nations,
    and they inherited what others had worked for
105.45:
so that they would obey his laws
    and follow his teachings.
Hallelujah!

106.1:
Hallelujah!
Give thanks to Yahweh because he is good,
    because his mercy endures forever.
106.2:
Who can speak about all the mighty things Yahweh has done?
    Who can announce all the things for which he is worthy of praise?
106.3:
Blessed are those who defend justice
    and do what is right at all times.
106.4:
Remember me, O Yahweh, when you show favor to your people.
    Come to help me with your salvation
106.5:
so that I may see the prosperity of your chosen ones,
    find joy in our people’s happiness,
        and brag with the people who belong to you.
106.6:
We have sinned, and so did our ancestors.
    We have done wrong.
    We are guilty.
106.7:
When our ancestors were in Egypt,
    they gave no thought to your miracles.
        They did not remember your numerous acts of mercy,
            so they rebelled at the sea, the Red Sea.
106.8:
He saved them because of his reputation
    so that he could make his mighty power known.
106.9:
He angrily commanded the Red Sea, and it dried up.
    He led them through deep water as though it were a desert.
106.10:
He rescued them from the power of the one who hated them.
    He rescued them from the enemy.
106.11:
Water covered their adversaries.
    Not one Egyptian survived.
106.12:
Then our ancestors believed what he said.
    They sang his praise.
106.13:
They quickly forgot what he did.
    They did not wait for his advice.
106.14:
They had an unreasonable desire for food in the wilderness.
    In the desert they tested El.
106.15:
He gave them what they asked for.
    He also gave them a degenerative disease.
106.16:
In the camp certain men became envious of Moses.
    They also became envious of Aaron, Yahweh’s holy one.
106.17:
The ground split open and swallowed Dathan.
    It buried Abiram’s followers.
106.18:
A fire broke out among their followers.
    Flames burned up wicked people.
106.19:
At Mount Horeb they made a statue of a calf.
    They worshiped an idol made of metal.
106.20:
They traded their glorious God
    for the statue of a bull that eats grass.
106.21:
They forgot El, their savior,
    the one who did spectacular things in Egypt,
106.22:
miracles in the land of Ham,
    and terrifying things at the Red Sea.
106.23:
El said he was going to destroy them,
    but Moses, his chosen one, stood in his way
        to prevent him from exterminating them.
106.24:
They refused to enter the pleasant land.
    They did not believe what he said.
106.25:
They complained in their tents.
    They did not obey Yahweh.
106.26:
Raising his hand, he swore
    that he would kill them in the wilderness,
106.27:
kill their descendants among the nations,
    and scatter them throughout various lands.
106.28:
They joined in worshiping the god Baal while they were at Peor,
    and they ate what was sacrificed to the dead.
106.29:
They infuriated Yahweh by what they did,
    and a plague broke out among them.
106.30:
Then Phinehas stood between Yahweh and the people,
    and the plague was stopped.
106.31:
Because of this, Phinehas was considered righteous forever,
    throughout every generation.
106.32:
They made Yahweh angry by the water at Meribah.
    Things turned out badly for Moses because of what they did,
106.33: since they made him bitter so that he spoke recklessly.
106.34: They did not destroy the people as Yahweh had told them.
106.35:
Instead, they intermarried with other nations.
    They learned to do what other nations did,
106.36:
and they worshiped their idols,
    which became a trap for them.
106.37: They sacrificed their sons and daughters to demons.
106.38:
They shed innocent blood,
    the blood of their own sons and daughters
        whom they sacrificed to the idols of Canaan.
            The land became polluted with blood.
106.39:
They became filthy because of what they did.
    They behaved like prostitutes.
106.40:
Yahweh burned with anger against his own people.
    He was disgusted with those who belonged to him.
106.41:
He handed them over to other nations,
    and those who hated them ruled them.
106.42:
Their enemies oppressed them
    and made them subject to their power.
106.43:
He rescued them many times,
    but they continued to plot rebellion against him
        and to sink deeper because of their sin.
106.44:
He saw that they were suffering
    when he heard their cry for help.
106.45:
He remembered his promise to them.
    In keeping with his rich mercy, he changed his plans.
106.46:
He let them find compassion
    from all those who held them captive.
106.47:
Rescue us, O Yahweh our Elohim, and gather us from the nations
    so that we may give thanks to your holy name
        and make your praise our glory.
106.48:
Thanks be to Yahweh Elohim of Israel
    from everlasting to everlasting.
        Let all the people say amen.
    Hallelujah!

107.1:
Give thanks to Yahweh because he is good,
    because his mercy endures forever.
107.2:
Let the people Yahweh defended repeat these words.
    They are the people he defended from the power of their enemies
107.4:
They wandered around the desert on a deserted road
    without finding an inhabited city.
107.5:
They were hungry and thirsty.
    They began to lose hope.
107.6:
In their distress they cried out to Yahweh.
    He rescued them from their troubles.
107.7: He led them on a road that went straight to an inhabited city.
107.8:
Let them give thanks to Yahweh because of his mercy.
    He performed his miracles for Adam’s descendants.
107.9:
He gave plenty to drink to those who were thirsty.
    He filled those who were hungry with good food.
107.10:
Those who lived in the dark, in death’s shadow
    were prisoners in misery.
        They were held in iron chains
107.11:
because they had rebelled against El’s words
    and had despised the advice given by Elyon.
107.12:
So he humbled them with hard work.
    They fell down, but no one was there to help them.
107.13:
In their distress they cried out to Yahweh.
    He saved them from their troubles.
107.14:
He brought them out of the dark, out of death’s shadow.
    He broke apart their chains.
107.15:
Let them give thanks to Yahweh because of his mercy.
    He performed his miracles for Adam’s descendants.
107.16:
He shattered bronze gates
    and cut iron bars in two.
107.17:
Fools suffered because of their disobedience
    and because of their crimes.
107.18:
All food was disgusting to them,
    and they came near death’s gates.
107.19:
In their distress they cried out to Yahweh.
    He saved them from their troubles.
107.20:
He sent his message and healed them.
    He rescued them from the grave.
107.21:
Let them give thanks to Yahweh because of his mercy.
    He performed his miracles for Adam’s descendants.
107.22:
Let them bring songs of thanksgiving as their sacrifice.
    Let them tell in joyful songs what he has done.
107.23:
Those who sail on the sea in ships,
    who do business on the high seas,
107.24:
have seen what Yahweh can do,
    the miracles he performed in the depths of the sea.
107.25:
He spoke, and a storm began to blow,
    and it made the waves rise high.
107.26:
The sailors aboard ship rose toward the sky.
    They plunged into the depths.
        Their courage melted in the face of disaster.
107.27:
They reeled and staggered like drunks,
    and all their skills as sailors became useless.
107.28:
In their distress they cried out to Yahweh.
    He led them from their troubles.
107.29:
He made the storm calm down,
    and the waves became still.
107.30:
The sailors were glad that the storm was quiet.
    He guided them to the harbor they had longed for.
107.31:
Let them give thanks to Yahweh because of his mercy.
    He performed his miracles for Adam’s descendants.
107.32:
Let them glorify him when the people are gathered for worship.
    Let them praise him in the company of respected leaders.
107.33:
He changes rivers into a desert,
    springs into thirsty ground,
107.34:
and fertile ground into a layer of salt
    because of the wickedness of the people living there.
107.35:
He changes deserts into lakes
    and dry ground into springs.
107.36:
There he settles those who are hungry,
    and they build cities to live in.
107.37:
They plant in fields and vineyards
    that produce crops.
107.38:
He blesses them, and their numbers multiply,
    and he does not allow a shortage of cattle.
107.39:
They became few in number and were humiliated
    because of oppression, disaster, and sorrow.
107.40:
He poured contempt on their influential people
    and made them stumble around in a pathless desert.
107.41:
But now he lifts needy people high above suffering
    and makes their families like flocks.
107.42:
Decent people will see this and rejoice,
    but all the wicked people will shut their mouths.
107.43:
Let those who think they are wise
    pay attention to these things
        so that they may understand Yahweh’s blessings.

108.1:
My heart is confident, O Elohim.
    I want to sing and make music even with my soul.
108.2:
Wake up, harp and lyre!
    I want to wake up at dawn.
108.3:
I want to give thanks to you among the people, O Yahweh.
    I want to make music to praise you among the nations
108.4:
because your mercy is higher than the heavens.
    Your truth reaches the skies.
108.5:
May you be honored above the heavens, O Elohim.
    Let your glory extend over the whole earth.
108.6:
Save us with your powerful hand, and answer us
    so that those who are dear to you may be rescued.
108.7:
Elohim has promised the following through his holiness:
    “I will triumph!
        I will divide Shechem.
        I will measure the valley of Succoth.
108.8:
Gilead is mine.
        Manasseh is mine.
        Ephraim is the helmet on my head.
        Judah is my scepter.
108.9:
Moab is my washtub.
        I will throw my shoe over Edom.
        I will shout in triumph over Philistia.”
108.10:
Who will bring me into the fortified city?
    Who will lead me to Edom?
108.11:
Isn’t it you, O Elohim, who rejected us?
    Isn’t it you, O Elohim, who refused to accompany our armies?
108.12:
Give us help against the enemy
    because human assistance is worthless.
108.13:
With Elohim we will display great strength.
    He will trample our enemies.

109.1: O Elohim, whom I praise, do not turn a deaf ear to me.
109.2:
Wicked and deceitful people have opened their mouths against me.
    They speak against me with lying tongues.
109.3:
They surround me with hateful words.
    They fight against me for no reason.
109.4:
In return for my love, they accuse me,
    but I pray for them.
109.5:
They reward me with evil instead of good
    and with hatred instead of love.
109.6:
I said, “Appoint the evil one to oppose him.
    Let Satan stand beside him.
109.7:
When he stands trial,
            let him be found guilty.
            Let his prayer be considered sinful.
109.8:
Let his days be few in number.
    Let someone else take his position.
109.9: “Let his children become fatherless and his wife a widow.
109.10:
Let his children wander around and beg.
    Let them seek help far from their ruined homes.
109.11:
Let a creditor take everything he owns.
    Let strangers steal what he has worked for.
109.12:
Let no one be kind to him anymore.
    Let no one show any pity to his fatherless children.
109.13:
Let his descendants be cut off
    and their family name be wiped out by the next generation.
109.14:
Let Yahweh remember the guilt of his ancestors
    and not wipe out his mother’s sin.
109.15:
Let their guilt and sin always remain on record
    in front of Yahweh.
        Let Yahweh remove every memory of him from the earth,
109.16:
because he did not remember to be kind.
    “He drove oppressed, needy,
        and brokenhearted people to their graves.
109.17:
He loved to put curses on others,
    so he, too, was cursed.
        He did not like to bless others,
            so he never received a blessing.
109.18:
He wore cursing as though it were clothing,
    so cursing entered his body like water
        and his bones like oil.
109.19:
Let cursing be his clothing,
    a belt he always wears.”
109.20:
This is how Yahweh rewards those who accuse me,
    those who say evil things against me.
109.21:
O Yahweh Adonay, deal with me out of the goodness of your name.
    Rescue me because of your mercy.
109.22:
I am oppressed and needy.
    I can feel the pain in my heart.
109.23:
I fade away like a lengthening shadow.
    I have been shaken off like a grasshopper.
109.24:
My knees give way because I have been fasting.
    My body has become lean, without any fat.
109.25:
I have become the victim of my enemies’ insults.
    They look at me and shake their heads.
109.26:
Help me, O Yahweh my Elohim.
    Save me because of your mercy.
109.27:
Then they will know that this is your doing,
    that you, O Yahweh, are the one who saved me.
109.28:
They may curse, but you will bless.
    Let those who attack me be ashamed,
    but let me rejoice.
109.29:
Let those who accuse me wear disgrace as though it were clothing.
    Let them be wrapped in their shame as though it were a robe.
109.30:
With my mouth I will give many thanks to Yahweh.
    I will praise him among many people,
109.31:
because he stands beside needy people
    to save them from those who would condemn them to death.

110.1:
Yahweh said to my Lord,
    “Sit in the highest position in heaven
        until I make your enemies your footstool.”
110.2:
Yahweh will extend your powerful scepter from Zion.
    Rule your enemies who surround you.
110.3:
Your people will volunteer when you call up your army.
    Your young people will come to you in holy splendor
        like dew in the early morning.
110.4:
Yahweh has taken an oath and will not change his mind:
    “You are a priest forever, in the way Melchizedek was a priest.”
110.5:
Adonay is at your right side.
    He will crush kings on the day of his anger.
110.6:
He will pass judgment on the nations
    and fill them with dead bodies.
        Throughout the earth he will crush their heads.
110.7:
He will drink from the brook along the road.
    He will hold his head high.

111.1:
Hallelujah!
I will give thanks to Yahweh with all my heart
    in the company of decent people and in the congregation.
111.2:
Yahweh’s deeds are spectacular.
    They should be studied by all who enjoy them.
111.3:
His work is glorious and majestic.
    His righteousness continues forever.
111.4:
He has made his miracles unforgettable.
    Yahweh is merciful and compassionate.
111.5:
He provides food for those who fear him.
    He always remembers his promise.
111.6:
He has revealed the power of his works to his people
    by giving them the lands of other nations as an inheritance.
111.7:
His works are done with truth and justice.
    All his guiding principles are trustworthy.
111.8:
They last forever and ever.
        They are carried out with truth and decency.
111.9:
He has sent salvation to his people.
    He has ordered that his promise should continue forever.
    His name is holy and terrifying.
111.10:
The fear of Yahweh is the beginning of wisdom.
    Good sense is shown by everyone who follows God’s guiding principles.
    His praise continues forever.

112.1:
Hallelujah!
Blessed is the person who fears Yahweh
    and is happy to obey his commands.
112.2:
His descendants will grow strong on the earth.
        The family of a decent person will be blessed.
112.3:
Wealth and riches will be in his home.
            His righteousness continues forever.
112.4:
Light will shine in the dark for a decent person.
    He is merciful, compassionate, and fair.
112.5:
All goes well for the person who is generous and lends willingly.
    He earns an honest living.
112.6:
He will never fail.
        A righteous person will always be remembered.
112.7:
He is not afraid of bad news.
            His heart remains secure, full of confidence in Yahweh.
112.8:
His heart is steady, and he is not afraid.
                In the end he will look triumphantly at his enemies.
112.9:
He gives freely to poor people.
            His righteousness continues forever.
            His head is raised in honor.
112.10:
The wicked person sees this and becomes angry.
    He angrily grits his teeth and disappears.
        The hope that wicked people have will vanish.

113.1:
Hallelujah!
You servants of Yahweh, praise him.
    Praise the name of Yahweh.
113.2: Thank the name of Yahweh now and forever.
113.3:
From where the sun rises to where the sun sets,
    the name of Yahweh should be praised.
113.4:
Yahweh is high above all the nations.
    His glory is above the heavens.
113.5:
Who is like Yahweh our Elohim?
    He is seated on his high throne.
113.6: He bends down to look at heaven and earth.
113.7:
He lifts the poor from the dust.
    He lifts the needy from a garbage heap.
113.8:
He seats them with influential people,
    with the influential leaders of his people.
113.9:
He makes a woman who is in a childless home
    a joyful mother.
Hallelujah!

114.1:
When Israel left Egypt,
    when Jacob’s family left people who spoke a foreign language,
114.2: Judah became his holy place and Israel became his kingdom.
114.3:
The Red Sea looked at this and ran away.
        The Jordan River turned back.
114.4:
The mountains jumped like rams.
            The hills jumped like lambs.
114.5:
Red Sea, why did you run away?
        Jordan River, what made you turn back?
114.6:
Mountains, what made you jump like rams?
            Hills, what made you jump like lambs?
114.7:
Earth, tremble in the presence of the Lord,
    in the presence of the Elohim of Jacob.
114.8:
He turns a rock into a pool filled with water
            and turns flint into a spring flowing with water.

115.1:
Don’t give glory to us, O Yahweh.
    Don’t give glory to us.
    Instead, give glory to your name
        because of your mercy and faithfulness.
115.2: Why should other nations say, “Where is their Elohim?”
115.3:
Our Elohim is in heaven.
    He does whatever he wants.
115.4:
Their idols are made of silver and gold.
    They were made by human hands.
115.5:
They have mouths, but they cannot speak.
        They have eyes, but they cannot see.
115.6:
They have ears, but they cannot hear.
        They have noses, but they cannot smell.
115.7:
They have hands, but they cannot feel.
        They have feet, but they cannot walk.
        They cannot even make a sound with their throats.
115.8:
Those who make idols end up like them.
                So does everyone who trusts them.
115.9:
Israel, trust Yahweh.
    He is your helper and your Magen.
115.10:
Descendants of Aaron, trust Yahweh.
    He is your helper and your Magen.
115.11:
If you fear Yahweh, trust Yahweh.
    He is your helper and your Magen.
115.12:
Yahweh, who is always thinking about us, will bless us.
    He will bless the descendants of Israel.
    He will bless the descendants of Aaron.
115.13:
He will bless those who fear Yahweh,
    from the least important to the most important.
115.14: May Yahweh continue to bless you and your children.
115.15: You will be blessed by Yahweh, the maker of heaven and earth.
115.16:
The highest heaven belongs to Yahweh,
    but he has given the earth to the descendants of Adam.
115.17:
Those who are dead do not praise Yah,
    nor do those who go into the silence of the grave.
115.18:
But we will thank Yah now and forever.
Hallelujah!

116.1: I love Yahweh because he hears my voice, my pleas for mercy.
116.2:
I will call on him as long as I live
    because he turns his ear toward me.
116.3:
The ropes of death became tangled around me.
    The horrors of the grave took hold of me.
        I experienced pain and agony.
116.4:
But I kept calling on the name of Yahweh:
    “Please, Yahweh, rescue me!”
116.5:
Yahweh is merciful and righteous.
    Our Elohim is compassionate.
116.6:
Yahweh protects defenseless people.
    When I was weak, he saved me.
116.7:
Be at peace again, my soul,
    because Yahweh has been good to you.
116.8:
You saved me from death.
    You saved my eyes from tears and my feet from stumbling.
116.9: I will walk in Yahweh’s presence in this world of the living.
116.10:
I kept my faith even when I said,
    “I am suffering terribly.”
116.11:
I also said when I was panic-stricken,
    “Everyone is undependable.”
116.12:
How can I repay Yahweh
    for all the good that he has done for me?
116.13:
I will take the cup of salvation
    and call on the name of Yahweh.
116.14:
I will keep my vows to Yahweh
    in the presence of all his people.
116.15:
Precious in the sight of Yahweh
    is the death of his faithful ones.
116.16:
O Yahweh, I am indeed your servant.
    I am your servant,
        the son of your female servant.
    You have freed me from my chains.
116.17:
I will bring a song of thanksgiving to you as a sacrifice.
    I will call on the name of Yahweh.
116.18:
I will keep my vows to Yahweh
    in the presence of all his people,
116.19:
in the courtyards of Yahweh’s house,
    in the middle of Jerusalem.
Hallelujah!

117.1:
Praise Yahweh, all you nations!
    Praise him, all you people of the world!
117.2:
His mercy toward us is powerful.
    Yahweh’s faithfulness endures forever.
Hallelujah!

118.1:
Give thanks to Yahweh because he is good,
    because his mercy endures forever.
118.2:
Israel should say,
            “His mercy endures forever.”
118.3:
The descendants of Aaron should say,
            “His mercy endures forever.”
118.4:
Those who fear Yahweh should say,
            “His mercy endures forever.”
118.5:
During times of trouble I called on Yah.
    Yah answered me and set me free from all of them.
118.6:
Yahweh is on my side.
    I am not afraid.
        What can mortals do to me?
118.7:
Yahweh is on my side as my helper.
    I will see the defeat of those who hate me.
118.8:
It is better to depend on Yahweh
    than to trust mortals.
118.9:
It is better to depend on Yahweh
    than to trust influential people.
118.10:
All the nations surrounded me,
    but armed with the name of Yahweh, I defeated them.
118.11:
They surrounded me. Yes, they surrounded me,
    but armed with the name of Yahweh, I defeated them.
118.12:
They swarmed around me like bees,
    but they were extinguished like burning thornbushes.
        So armed with the name of Yahweh, I defeated them.
118.13:
They pushed hard to make me fall,
    but Yahweh helped me.
118.14:
Yah is my strength and my song.
    He is my savior.
118.15:
The sound of joyful singing and victory is heard
    in the tents of righteous people.
        The right hand of Yahweh displays strength.
118.16:
The right hand of Yahweh is held high.
    The right hand of Yahweh displays strength.
118.17:
I will not die,
    but I will live and tell what Yah has done.
118.18:
Yah disciplined me severely,
    but he did not allow me to be killed.
118.19:
Open the gates of righteousness for me.
    I will go through them and give thanks to Yah.
118.20:
This is the gate of Yahweh
    through which righteous people will enter.
118.21:
I give thanks to you,
    because you have answered me.
        You are my savior.
118.22:
The stone that the builders rejected
    has become the cornerstone.
118.23:
Yahweh is responsible for this,
    and it is amazing for us to see.
118.24:
This is the day Yahweh has made.
    Let’s rejoice and be glad today!
118.25:
We beg you, O Yahweh, save us!
    We beg you, O Yahweh, give us success!
118.26:
Blessed is the one who comes in the name of Yahweh.
    We bless you from Yahweh’s house.
118.27:
Yahweh is El, and he has given us light.
    March in a festival procession
        with branches to the horns of the altar.
118.28:
You are my El, and I give thanks to you.
    My Elohim, I honor you highly.
118.29:
Give thanks to Yahweh because he is good,
    because his mercy endures forever.

119.1:
Blessed are those whose lives have integrity,
    those who follow the teachings of Yahweh.
119.2:
Blessed are those who obey his written instructions.
    They wholeheartedly search for him.
119.3:
They do nothing wrong.
    They follow his directions.
119.4:
You have commanded
    that your guiding principles be carefully followed.
119.5:
I pray that my ways may become firmly established
    so that I can obey your laws.
119.6:
Then I will never feel ashamed
            when I study all your commandments.
119.7:
I will give thanks to you
    as I learn your regulations, which are based on your righteousness.
119.8:
I will obey your laws.
    Never abandon me.
119.9:
How can a young person keep his life pure?
    He can do it by holding on to your word.
119.10:
I wholeheartedly searched for you.
    Do not let me wander away from your commandments.
119.11:
I have treasured your promise in my heart
    so that I may not sin against you.
119.12:
Thanks be to you, O Yahweh.
    Teach me your laws.
119.13:
With my lips I have repeated
    every regulation that comes from your mouth.
119.14:
I find joy in the way shown by your written instructions
    more than I find joy in all kinds of riches.
119.15:
I want to reflect on your guiding principles
    and study your ways.
119.16:
Your laws make me happy.
    I never forget your word.
119.17:
Be kind to me so that I may live
    and hold on to your word.
119.18:
Uncover my eyes
    so that I may see the miraculous things in your teachings.
119.19:
I am a foreigner in this world.
    Do not hide your commandments from me.
119.20: My soul is overwhelmed with endless longing for your regulations.
119.21:
You threaten arrogant people, who are condemned
    and wander away from your commandments.
119.22:
Remove the insults and contempt that have fallen on me
    because I have obeyed your written instructions.
119.23:
Even though influential people plot against me,
    I reflect on your laws.
119.24:
Indeed, your written instructions make me happy.
    They are my best friends.
119.25:
I am close to death.
    Give me a new life as you promised.
119.26:
I told you what I have done, and you answered me.
    Teach me your laws.
119.27:
Help me understand your guiding principles
    so that I may reflect on your miracles.
119.28:
I am drowning in tears.
    Strengthen me as you promised.
119.29:
Turn me away from a life of lies.
    Graciously provide me with your teachings.
119.30:
I have chosen a life of faithfulness.
    I have set your regulations in front of me.
119.31:
I have clung tightly to your written instructions.
    O Yahweh, do not let me be put to shame.
119.32:
I will eagerly pursue your commandments
    because you continue to increase my understanding.
119.33:
Teach me, O Yahweh, how to live by your laws,
    and I will obey them to the end.
119.34:
Help me understand so that I can follow your teachings.
    I will guard them with all my heart.
119.35:
Lead me on the path of your commandments,
    because I am happy with them.
119.36:
Direct my heart toward your written instructions
    rather than getting rich in underhanded ways.
119.37:
Turn my eyes away from worthless things.
    Give me a new life in your ways.
119.38:
Keep your promise to me
    so that I can fear you.
119.39:
Take away insults, which I dread,
    because your regulations are good.
119.40:
I long for your guiding principles.
    Give me a new life in your righteousness.
119.41:
Let your blessings reach me, O Yahweh.
    Save me as you promised.
119.42:
Then I will have an answer for the one who insults me
    since I trust your word.
119.43:
Do not take so much as a single word of truth from my mouth.
    My hope is based on your regulations.
119.44: I will follow your teachings forever and ever.
119.45:
I will walk around freely
    because I sought out your guiding principles.
119.46:
I will speak about your written instructions in the presence of kings
    and not feel ashamed.
119.47: Your commandments, which I love, make me happy.
119.48:
I lift my hands in prayer because of your commandments,
    which I love.
    I will reflect on your laws.
119.49:
Remember the word you gave me.
    Through it you gave me hope.
119.50:
This is my comfort in my misery:
    Your promise gave me a new life.
119.51:
Arrogant people have mocked me with cruelty,
    yet I have not turned away from your teachings.
119.52:
I remembered your regulations from long ago, O Yahweh,
    and I found comfort in them.
119.53:
I am burning with anger because of wicked people,
    who abandon your teachings.
119.54:
Your laws have become like psalms to me
    in this place where I am only a foreigner.
119.55:
At night I remember your name, O Yahweh,
    and I follow your teachings.
119.56:
This has happened to me
    because I have obeyed your guiding principles.
119.57:
You are my inheritance, O Yahweh.
    I promised to hold on to your words.
119.58:
With all my heart I want to win your favor.
    Be kind to me as you promised.
119.59:
I have thought about my life,
    and I have directed my feet back to your written instructions.
119.60: Without any hesitation I hurry to obey your commandments.
119.61:
Though the ropes of wicked people are tied around me,
    I never forget your teachings.
119.62:
At midnight I wake up to give thanks to you
    for the regulations, which are based on your righteousness.
119.63:
I am a friend to everyone who fears you
    and to everyone who follows your guiding principles.
119.64:
Your mercy, O Yahweh, fills the earth.
    Teach me your laws.
119.65:
You have treated me well, O Yahweh,
    as you promised.
119.66:
Teach me to use good judgment and knowledge,
    because I believe in your commandments.
119.67:
Before you made me suffer, I used to wander off,
    but now I hold on to your word.
119.68:
You are good, and you do good things.
    Teach me your laws.
119.69:
Arrogant people have smeared me with lies,
    yet I obey your guiding principles with all my heart.
119.70:
Their hearts are cold and insensitive,
    yet I am happy with your teachings.
119.71:
It was good that I had to suffer
    in order to learn your laws.
119.72:
The teachings that come from your mouth are worth more to me
    than thousands in gold or silver.
119.73:
Your hands created me and made me what I am.
    Help me understand so that I may learn your commandments.
119.74:
Those who fear you will see me and rejoice,
    because my hope is based on your word.
119.75:
I know that your regulations are fair, O Yahweh,
    and that you were right to make me suffer.
119.76:
Let your mercy comfort me
    as you promised.
119.77:
Let your compassion reach me so that I may live,
    because your teachings make me happy.
119.78:
Let arrogant people be put to shame
    because they lied about me,
        yet I reflect on your guiding principles.
119.79:
Let those who fear you turn to me
    so that they can come to know your written instructions.
119.80:
Let my heart be filled with integrity in regard to your laws
    so that I will not be put to shame.
119.81:
My soul is weak from waiting for you to save me.
    My hope is based on your word.
119.82:
My eyes have become strained from looking for your promise.
    I ask, “When will you comfort me?”
119.83:
Although I have become like a shriveled and dried out wineskin,
    I have not forgotten your laws.
119.84:
What is left of my life?
    When will you bring those who persecute me to justice?
119.85:
Arrogant people have dug pits to trap me
    in defiance of your teachings.
119.86:
(All your commandments are reliable.)
    Those people persecute me with lies. Help me!
119.87:
They almost wiped me off the face of the earth.
    But I did not abandon your guiding principles.
119.88:
Give me a new life through your mercy
    so that I may obey the written instructions,
        which came from your mouth.
119.89: O Yahweh, your word is established in heaven forever.
119.90:
Your faithfulness endures throughout every generation.
    You set the earth in place, and it continues to stand.
119.91:
All things continue to stand today because of your regulations,
    since they are all your servants.
119.92:
If your teachings had not made me happy,
    then I would have died in my misery.
119.93:
I will never forget your guiding principles,
    because you gave me a new life through them.
119.94:
I am yours.
    Save me, because I have searched for your guiding principles.
119.95:
The wicked people have waited for me in order to destroy me,
    yet I want to understand your written instructions.
119.96:
I have seen a limit to everything else,
    but your commandments have no limit.
119.97:
Oh, how I love your teachings!
    They are in my thoughts all day long.
119.98:
Your commandments make me wiser than my enemies,
    because your commandments are always with me.
119.99:
I have more insight than all my teachers,
    because your written instructions are in my thoughts.
119.100:
I have more wisdom than those with many years of experience,
    because I have obeyed your guiding principles.
119.101:
I have kept my feet from walking on any evil path
    in order to obey your word.
119.102:
I have not neglected your regulations,
    because you have taught me.
119.103:
How sweet the taste of your promise is!
    It tastes sweeter than honey.
119.104:
From your guiding principles I gain understanding.
    That is why I hate every path that leads to lying.
119.105:
Your word is a lamp for my feet
    and a light for my path.
119.106:
I took an oath, and I will keep it.
    I took an oath to follow your regulations,
        which are based on your righteousness.
119.107:
I have suffered so much.
    Give me a new life, O Yahweh, as you promised.
119.108:
Please accept the praise I gladly give you, O Yahweh,
    and teach me your regulations.
119.109:
I always take my life into my own hands,
    but I never forget your teachings.
119.110:
Wicked people have set a trap for me,
    but I have never wandered away from your guiding principles.
119.111:
Your written instructions are mine forever.
    They are the joy of my heart.
119.112:
I have decided to obey your laws.
    They offer a reward that never ends.
119.113:
I hate two-faced people,
    but I love your teachings.
119.114:
You are my hiding place and my shield.
    My hope is based on your word.
119.115:
Get away from me, you evildoers,
    so that I can obey the commandments of my Elohim.
119.116:
Help me Elohim, as you promised, so that I may live.
    Do not turn my hope into disappointment.
119.117:
Hold me, and I will be safe,
    and I will always respect your laws.
119.118:
You reject all who wander away from your laws,
    because their lies mislead them.
119.119:
You get rid of all wicked people on earth as if they were rubbish.
    That is why I love your written instructions.
119.120:
My body shudders in fear of you,
    and I am afraid of your regulations.
119.121:
I have done what is fair and right.
    Do not leave me at the mercy of those who oppress me.
119.122:
Guarantee my well-being.
    Do not let arrogant people oppress me.
119.123:
My eyes are strained from looking for you to save me
    and from looking for the fulfillment of your righteous promise.
119.124:
Treat me with kindness,
    and teach me your laws.
119.125:
I am your servant.
    Help me understand
        so that I may come to know your written instructions.
119.126:
It is time for you to act, O Yahweh.
    Even though people have abolished your teachings,
119.127: I love your commandments more than gold, more than pure gold.
119.128:
I follow the straight paths of your guiding principles.
    I hate every pathway that leads to lying.
119.129:
Your written instructions are miraculous.
    That is why I obey them.
119.130:
Your word is a doorway that lets in light,
    and it helps gullible people understand.
119.131:
I open my mouth and pant
    because I long for your commandments.
119.132:
Turn toward me, and have pity on me
    as you have pledged to do for those who love your name.
119.133:
Make my steps secure through your promise,
    and do not let any sin control me.
119.134:
Save me from human oppression
    so that I may obey your guiding principles.
119.135:
Smile on me,
    and teach me your laws.
119.136:
Streams of tears flow from my eyes
    because others do not follow your teachings.
119.137:
You are righteous, O Yahweh,
    and your regulations are fair.
119.138:
You have issued your written instructions.
    They are fair and completely dependable.
119.139:
My devotion for your words consumes me,
    because my enemies have forgotten your words.
119.140:
Your promise has been thoroughly tested,
    and I love it.
119.141:
I am unimportant and despised,
    yet I never forget your guiding principles.
119.142:
Your righteousness is an everlasting righteousness,
    and your teachings are reliable.
119.143:
Trouble and hardship have found me,
    but your commandments still make me happy.
119.144:
Your written instructions are always right.
    Help me understand them so that I will live.
119.145:
I have called out with all my heart. Answer me, O Yahweh.
    I want to obey your laws.
119.146:
I have called out.
    Save me, so that I can obey your written instructions.
119.147:
I got up before dawn, and I cried out for help.
    My hope is based on your word.
119.148:
My eyes are wide-open throughout the nighttime hours
    to reflect on your word.
119.149:
In keeping with your mercy, hear my voice.
    O Yahweh, give me a new life guided by your regulations.
119.150:
Those who carry out plots against me are near,
    yet they are far away from your teachings.
119.151:
You are near, O Yahweh,
    and all your commandments are reliable.
119.152:
Long ago I learned from your written instructions
    that you made them to last forever.
119.153:
Look at my misery, and rescue me,
    because I have never forgotten your teachings.
119.154:
Plead my case for me, and save me.
    Give me a new life as you promised.
119.155:
Wicked people are far from being saved,
    because they have not searched for your laws.
119.156:
Your acts of compassion are many in number, O Yahweh.
    Give me a new life guided by your regulations.
119.157:
I have many persecutors and opponents,
    yet I have not turned away from your written instructions.
119.158:
I have seen traitors,
    and I am filled with disgust.
        They have not accepted your promise.
119.159:
See how I have loved your guiding principles!
    O Yahweh, in keeping with your mercy, give me a new life.
119.160:
There is nothing but truth in your word,
    and all of your righteous regulations endure forever.
119.161:
Influential people have persecuted me for no reason,
    but it is only your words that fill my heart with terror.
119.162:
I find joy in your promise
    like someone who finds a priceless treasure.
119.163:
I hate lying; I am disgusted with it.
    I love your teachings.
119.164:
Seven times a day I praise you
    for your righteous regulations.
119.165:
There is lasting peace for those who love your teachings.
    Nothing can make those people stumble.
119.166:
I have waited with hope for you to save me, O Yahweh.
    I have carried out your commandments.
119.167:
I have obeyed your written instructions.
    I have loved them very much.
119.168:
I have followed your guiding principles and your written instructions,
    because my whole life is in front of you.
119.169:
Let my cry for help come into your presence, O Yahweh.
    Help me understand as you promised.
119.170:
Let my plea for mercy come into your presence.
    Rescue me as you promised.
119.171:
Let my lips pour out praise
    because you teach me your laws.
119.172:
Let my tongue sing about your promise
    because all your commandments are fair.
119.173:
Let your hand help me
    because I have chosen to follow your guiding principles.
119.174:
I have longed for you to save me, O Yahweh,
    and your teachings make me happy.
119.175:
Let my soul have new life so that it can praise you.
    Let your regulations help me.
119.176:
I have wandered away like a lost lamb.
    Search for me,
        because I have never forgotten your commandments.

120.1:
When I was in trouble, I cried out to Yahweh,
    and he answered me.
120.2:
O Yahweh, rescue me from lying lips
    and from a deceitful tongue.
120.3:
You deceitful tongue, what can Yahweh give you?
    What more can he do for you?
120.4: He will give you a warrior’s sharpened arrows and red-hot coals.
120.5:
How horrible it is to live as a foreigner in Meshech
    or to stay in the tents of Kedar.
120.6: I have lived too long with those who hate peace.
120.7:
I am for peace, but when I talk about it,
            they only talk about war.

121.1:
I look up toward the mountains.
    Where can I find help?
121.2:
My help comes from Yahweh,
    the maker of heaven and earth.
121.3:
He will not let you fall.
    Your guardian will not fall asleep.
121.4: Indeed, the Guardian of Israel never rests or sleeps.
121.5:
Yahweh is your guardian.
    Yahweh is the shade over your right hand.
121.6:
The sun will not beat down on you during the day,
    nor will the moon at night.
121.7:
Yahweh guards you from every evil.
    He guards your life.
121.8:
Yahweh guards you as you come and go,
    now and forever.

122.1:
I was glad when they said to me,
    “Let’s go to the house of Yahweh.”
122.2: Our feet are standing inside your gates, Jerusalem.
122.3:
Jerusalem is built to be a city
    where the people are united.
122.4:
All of Yah’s tribes go to that city
    because it is a law in Israel
        to give thanks to the name of Yahweh.
122.5:
The court of justice sits there.
    It consists of princes who are David’s descendants.
122.6:
Pray for the peace of Jerusalem:
    “May those who love you prosper.
122.7:
May there be peace inside your walls
    and prosperity in your palaces.”
122.8:
For the sake of my relatives and friends, let me say,
    “May it go well for you!”
122.9:
For the sake of the house of Yahweh our Elohim,
    I will seek what is good for you.

123.1:
I look up to you,
    to the one who sits enthroned in heaven.
123.2:
As servants depend on their masters,
    as a maid depends on her mistress,
    so we depend on Yahweh our Elohim
        until he has pity on us.
123.3:
Have pity on us, O Yahweh.
    Have pity on us
    because we have suffered more than our share of contempt.
123.4:
We have suffered more than our share of ridicule
    from those who are carefree.
    We have suffered more than our share of contempt
    from those who are arrogant.

124.1:
“If Yahweh had not been on our side . . .”
    (Israel should repeat this.)
124.2: “If Yahweh had not been on our side when people attacked us,
124.3:
then they would have swallowed us alive
    when their anger exploded against us.
124.4:
Then the floodwaters would have swept us away.
    An overflowing stream would have washed us away.
124.5: Then raging water would have washed us away.”
124.6: Thank Yahweh, who did not let them sink their teeth into us.
124.7:
We escaped like a bird caught in a hunter’s trap.
    The trap was broken, and we escaped.
124.8: Our help is in the name of Yahweh, the maker of heaven and earth.

125.1:
Those who trust Yahweh are like Mount Zion,
    which can never be shaken.
        It remains firm forever.
125.2:
As the mountains surround Jerusalem,
    so Yahweh surrounds his people now and forever.
125.3:
A wicked ruler will not be allowed to govern
    the land set aside for righteous people.
        That is why righteous people do not use their power to do wrong.
125.4:
Do good, O Yahweh, to those who are good,
    to those whose motives are decent.
125.5:
But when people become crooked,
    Yahweh will lead them away with troublemakers.
Let there be peace in Israel!

126.1:
When Yahweh restored the fortunes of Zion,
    it was as if we were dreaming.
126.2:
Then our mouths were filled with laughter
    and our tongues with joyful songs.
    Then the nations said,
    “Yahweh has done spectacular things for them.”
126.3:
Yahweh has done spectacular things for us.
    We are overjoyed.
126.4:
Restore our fortunes, O Yahweh,
    as you restore streams to dry riverbeds in the Negev.
126.5:
Those who cry while they plant
    will joyfully sing while they harvest.
126.6:
The person who goes out weeping, carrying his bag of seed,
    will come home singing, carrying his bundles of grain.

127.1:
If Yahweh does not build the house,
    it is useless for the builders to work on it.
    If Yahweh does not protect a city,
    it is useless for the guard to stay alert.
127.2:
It is useless to work hard for the food you eat
    by getting up early and going to bed late.
        Yahweh gives food to those he loves while they sleep.
127.3:
Children are an inheritance from Yahweh.
    They are a reward from him.
127.4:
The children born to a man when he is young
    are like arrows in the hand of a warrior.
127.5:
Blessed is the man who has filled his quiver with them.
            He will not be put to shame
                when he speaks with his enemies in the city gate.

128.1:
Blessed are all who fear Yahweh
    and live his way.
128.2:
You will certainly eat what your own hands have provided.
    Blessings to you!
    May things go well for you!
128.3:
Your wife will be like a fruitful vine inside your home.
    Your children will be like young olive trees around your table.
128.4: This is how Yahweh will bless the person who fears him.
128.5:
May Yahweh bless you from Zion
        so that you may see Jerusalem prospering
            all the days of your life.
128.6:
May you live to see your children’s children.
Let there be peace in Israel!

129.1:
“From the time I was young, people have attacked me . . .”
    (Israel should repeat this.)
129.2:
“From the time I was young, people have attacked me,
    but they have never overpowered me.
129.3:
They have plowed my back like farmers plow fields.
        They made long slashes like furrows.”
129.4:
Yahweh is righteous.
    He has cut me loose
        from the ropes that wicked people tied around me.
129.5:
Put to shame all those who hate Zion.
    Force them to retreat.
129.6:
Make them be like grass on a roof,
    like grass that dries up before it produces a stalk.
129.7:
It will never fill the barns of those who harvest
            or the arms of those who gather bundles.
129.8:
Those who pass by will never say to them,
    “May you be blessed by Yahweh”
    or “We bless you in the name of Yahweh.”

130.1: O Yahweh, out of the depths I call to you.
130.2:
O Adonay, hear my voice.
    Let your ears be open to my pleas for mercy.
130.3:
O Yahweh, who would be able to stand
    if you kept a record of sins?
130.4:
But with you there is forgiveness
    so that you can be feared.
130.5:
I wait for Yahweh, my soul waits,
    and with hope I wait for his word.
130.6:
My soul waits for Adonay
    more than those who watch for the morning,
    more than those who watch for the morning.
130.7:
O Israel, put your hope in Yahweh,
    because with Yahweh there is mercy
        and with him there is unlimited forgiveness.
130.8: He will rescue Israel from all its sins.

131.1:
O Yahweh, my heart is not conceited.
    My eyes do not look down on others.
    I am not involved in things too big or too difficult for me.
131.2:
Instead, I have kept my soul calm and quiet.
    My soul is content as a weaned child is content in its mother’s arms.
131.3: Israel, put your hope in Yahweh now and forever.

132.1: O Yahweh, remember David and all the hardships he endured.
132.2:
Remember how he swore an oath to Yahweh
    and made this vow to the Mighty One of Jacob:
132.3: “I will not step inside my house,
132.4: get into my bed, shut my eyes, or close my eyelids
132.5:
until I find a place for Yahweh,
    a dwelling place for the Mighty One of Jacob.”
132.6:
Now, we have heard about the ark of the promise being in Ephrathah.
    We have found it in Jaar.
132.7:
Let’s go to his dwelling place.
    Let’s worship at his footstool.
132.8:
O Yahweh, arise, and come to your resting place
    with the ark of your power.
132.9:
Clothe your priests with righteousness.
    Let your godly ones sing with joy.
132.10:
For the sake of your servant David,
    do not reject your anointed one.
132.11:
Yahweh swore an oath to David.
    This is a truth he will not take back:
        “I will set one of your own descendants on your throne.
132.12:
If your sons are faithful to my promise
    and my written instructions that I will teach them,
        then their descendants will also sit on your throne forever.”
132.13:
Yahweh has chosen Zion.
    He wants it for his home.
132.14:
“This will be my resting place forever.
    Here I will sit enthroned because I want Zion.
132.15:
I will certainly bless all that Zion needs.
    I will satisfy its needy people with food.
132.16:
I will clothe its priests with salvation.
    Then its godly ones will sing joyfully.
132.17:
There I will make a horn sprout up for David.
    I will prepare a lamp for my anointed one.
132.18:
I will clothe his enemies with shame,
    but the crown on my anointed one will shine.”

133.1:
See how good and pleasant it is
    when brothers and sisters live together in harmony!
133.2:
It is like fine, scented oil on the head,
            running down the beard—down Aaron’s beard—
            running over the collar of his robes.
133.3:
It is like dew on Mount Hermon,
            dew which comes down on Zion’s mountains.
                That is where Yahweh promised
                    the blessing of eternal life.

134.1:
Praise Yahweh, all you servants of Yahweh,
    all who stand in the house of Yahweh night after night.
134.2: Lift your hands toward the holy place, and praise Yahweh.
134.3: May Yahweh, the maker of heaven and earth, bless you from Zion.

135.1:
Hallelujah!
Praise the name of Yahweh.
    Praise him, you servants of Yahweh
135.2:
who are standing in the house of Yahweh,
    in the courtyards of the house of our Elohim.
135.3:
Praise Yah because Yahweh is good.
    Make music to praise his name because his name is beautiful.
135.4:
Yah chose Jacob to be his own
    and chose Israel to be his own special treasure.
135.5:
I know that Yahweh is great,
    that our Adonay is greater than all the false gods.
135.6:
Yahweh does whatever he wants in heaven or on earth,
    on the seas or in all the depths of the oceans.
135.7:
He is the one who makes the clouds rise from the ends of the earth,
    who makes lightning for the thunderstorms,
        and who brings wind out of his storerooms.
135.8:
He is the one who killed every firstborn male in Egypt.
    He killed humans and animals alike.
135.9:
He sent miraculous signs and amazing things into the heart of Egypt
    against Pharaoh and all his officials.
135.10: He is the one who defeated many nations and killed mighty kings:
135.11:
King Sihon of the Amorites,
    King Og of Bashan,
        and all the kingdoms in Canaan.
135.12:
He gave their land as an inheritance,
    an inheritance to his people Israel.
135.13:
O Yahweh, your name endures forever.
    O Yahweh, you will be remembered throughout every generation.
135.14:
Yahweh will provide justice for his people
    and have compassion on his servants.
135.15:
The idols of the nations are made of silver and gold.
    They were made by human hands.
135.16:
They have mouths, but they cannot speak.
    They have eyes, but they cannot see.
135.17:
They have ears, but they cannot hear.
    They cannot breathe.
135.18:
Those who make idols end up like them.
    So does everyone who trusts them.
135.19:
Descendants of Israel, praise Yahweh.
    Descendants of Aaron, praise Yahweh.
135.20:
Descendants of Levi, praise Yahweh.
    You people who fear Yahweh, praise Yahweh.
135.21:
Thank Yahweh in Zion.
    Thank the one who lives in Jerusalem.
Hallelujah!

136.1:
Give thanks to Yahweh because he is good,
because his mercy endures forever.
136.2:
Give thanks to the Elohim of gods
because his mercy endures forever.
136.3:
Give thanks to the Adonay of lords
because his mercy endures forever.
136.4:
Give thanks to the only one who does miraculous things—
because his mercy endures forever.
136.5:
to the one who made the heavens by his understanding—
because his mercy endures forever.
136.6:
to the one who spread out the earth on the water—
because his mercy endures forever.
136.7:
to the one who made the great lights—
because his mercy endures forever.
136.8:
the sun to rule the day—
because his mercy endures forever.
136.9:
the moon and stars to rule the night—
because his mercy endures forever.
136.10:
Give thanks to the one who killed the firstborn males in Egypt—
because his mercy endures forever.
136.11:
He brought Israel out from among them—
because his mercy endures forever.
136.12:
with a mighty hand and a powerful arm—
because his mercy endures forever.
136.13:
Give thanks to one who divided the Red Sea—
because his mercy endures forever.
136.14:
He led Israel through the middle of it—
because his mercy endures forever.
136.15:
He swept Pharaoh and his army into the Red Sea—
because his mercy endures forever.
136.16:
Give thanks to the one who led his people through the desert—
because his mercy endures forever.
136.17:
Give thanks to the one who defeated powerful kings—
because his mercy endures forever.
136.18:
He killed mighty kings—
because his mercy endures forever.
136.19:
King Sihon of the Amorites—
because his mercy endures forever.
136.20:
and King Og of Bashan—
because his mercy endures forever.
136.21:
He gave their land as an inheritance—
because his mercy endures forever.
136.22:
as an inheritance for his servant Israel—
because his mercy endures forever.
136.23:
He remembered us when we were humiliated—
because his mercy endures forever.
136.24:
He snatched us from the grasp of our enemies—
because his mercy endures forever.
136.25:
He gives food to every living creature—
because his mercy endures forever.
136.26:
Give thanks to El of heaven
because his mercy endures forever.

137.1:
By the rivers of Babylon, we sat down and cried
    as we remembered Zion.
137.2: We hung our lyres on willow trees.
137.3:
It was there that those who had captured us demanded that we sing.
    Those who guarded us wanted us to entertain them.
        They said, “Sing a song from Zion for us!”
137.4: How could we sing Yahweh’s song in a foreign land?
137.5:
If I forget you, Jerusalem,
    let my right hand forget how to play the lyre.
137.7:
O Yahweh, remember the people of Edom.
    Remember what they did the day Jerusalem was captured.
        They said, “Tear it down! Tear it down to its foundation.”
137.8:
You destructive people of Babylon,
    blessed is the one who pays you back
        with the same treatment you gave us.
137.9:
Blessed is the one who grabs your little children
    and smashes them against a rock.

138.1:
I will give thanks to you with all my heart.
    I will make music to praise you in front of the false gods.
138.2:
I will bow toward your holy temple.
    I will give thanks to your name because of your mercy and truth.
    You have made your name and your promise greater than everything.
138.3:
When I called, you answered me.
    You made me bold by strengthening my soul.
138.4:
All the kings of the earth will give thanks to you, O Yahweh,
    because they have heard the promises you spoke.
138.5:
They will sing this about the ways of Yahweh:
            “Yahweh’s honor is great!”
138.6:
Even though Yahweh is high above, he sees humble people close up,
    and he recognizes arrogant people from a distance.
138.7:
Even though I walk into the middle of trouble,
    you guard my life against the anger of my enemies.
    You stretch out your hand,
        and your right hand saves me.
138.8:
Yahweh will do everything for me.
    O Yahweh, your mercy endures forever.
    Do not let go of what your hands have made.

139.1: O Yahweh, you have examined me, and you know me.
139.2:
You alone know when I sit down and when I get up.
    You read my thoughts from far away.
139.3:
You watch me when I travel and when I rest.
    You are familiar with all my ways.
139.4:
Even before there is a single word on my tongue,
            you know all about it, Yahweh.
139.5:
You are all around me—in front of me and in back of me.
    You lay your hand on me.
139.6:
Such knowledge is beyond my grasp.
        It is so high I cannot reach it.
139.7:
Where can I go to get away from your Ruach?
    Where can I run to get away from you?
139.8:
If I go up to heaven, you are there.
    If I make my bed in hell, you are there.
139.9:
If I climb upward on the rays of the morning sun
    or land on the most distant shore of the sea where the sun sets,
139.10:
even there your hand would guide me
    and your right hand would hold on to me.
139.11:
If I say, “Let the darkness hide me
    and let the light around me turn into night,”
139.12:
even the darkness is not too dark for you.
    Night is as bright as day.
        Darkness and light are the same to you.
139.13:
You alone created my inner being.
    You knitted me together inside my mother.
139.14:
I will give thanks to you
    because I have been so amazingly and miraculously made.
        Your works are miraculous, and my soul is fully aware of this.
139.15:
My bones were not hidden from you
    when I was being made in secret,
    when I was being skillfully woven in an underground workshop.
139.16:
Your eyes saw me when I was only a fetus.
    Every day of my life was recorded in your book
        before one of them had taken place.
139.17:
How precious are your thoughts concerning me, O El!
    How vast in number they are!
139.18:
If I try to count them,
    there would be more of them than there are grains of sand.
        When I wake up, I am still with you.
139.19:
I wish that you would kill wicked people, O Eloah,
    and that bloodthirsty people would leave me alone.
139.20:
They say wicked things about you.
    Your enemies misuse your name.
139.21:
Shouldn’t I hate those who hate you, O Yahweh?
    Shouldn’t I be disgusted with those who attack you?
139.22:
I hate them with all my heart.
    They have become my enemies.
139.23:
Examine me, O El, and know my mind.
    Test me, and know my thoughts.
139.24:
See whether I am on an evil path.
    Then lead me on the everlasting path.

140.1:
Rescue me from evil people, O Yahweh.
    Keep me safe from violent people.
140.2:
